meanings.definition: A person or thing that notifies.
meanings.sent1: The notifiers in the office always make sure everyone knows about important meetings.
meanings.sent2: The notifiers on my phone keep me updated with the latest news alerts.
meanings.sent3: The little bird acted as a notifier, chirping loudly to warn the other animals of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stood tall like a notifier, guiding ships safely through the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The bright red flag served as a clear notifier of danger ahead.

meanings.definition: A software application that provides notifications.
meanings.sent1: I rely on the notifiers on my computer to remind me of upcoming appointments.
meanings.sent2: The notifiers on the messaging app let me know when I receive a new message.
meanings.sent3: The notifier on my phone decided to play a prank by sending notifications at random times.
meanings.sent4: The email notifier was like a diligent assistant, ensuring I never missed an important message.
meanings.sent5: The notifier on the screen flashed brightly, catching my attention immediately.

meanings.definition: The act of notifying or giving notice.
meanings.sent1: The notifiers from the school informed parents about the upcoming parent-teacher meeting.
meanings.sent2: The notifiers from the government alerted citizens about the approaching severe weather.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog became a notifier, barking loudly to let everyone know a visitor was at the door.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence in the room acted as a powerful notifier that something was wrong.
meanings.sent5: The ringing bell served as a clear notifier that class was about to begin.
